metadata.titel_preek: Sermon 41: On the Ascension of the Lord

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Ascension of Christ as a historical fact that demands a specific moral and emotional response (joy/fear) from the believer to secure future bliss.

tekstueel_bewijs: Those, therefore, who endured the privations... are entitled to rejoice
let us judge those of the future
everything we do for God’s glory gives us ever greater title to the bliss
we should await him, lest we be caught unprepared

object.identificatie: The bliss of possessing God / Eternal happiness
tekstueel_bewijs: possessing an ineffable reward which is none other than God himself
God, who is full of kindness and mercy, will... forgive us our present failings
those who, having suffered for the love of God
they merited the grace of contemplating the Lord
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject who must perform to become the Receiver.

tekstueel_bewijs: The presence of these many witnesses... assures us
fear of the penalty will help us avoid it
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Object to be attained or the Sender who judges, rather than the active Subject/Helper.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not Sin or Death as cosmic powers, but the hearer's own lack of 'fear' or 'merit'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The historical event of the Ascension itself (Christ's movement).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Christ
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (human merit) is built upon the secondary program (Christ's ascension) as a mere evidentiary foundation.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God (Judge) → Eternal Bliss → The Meritorious Believer

voorbeelden_god_subject: God both allows and obliges us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: everything we do for God’s glory

voorbeelden: if we don’t choose to benefit
suffered for the love of God

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward obligation (Devoir). It assumes the hearer has the inherent power (Pouvoir) to convert and endure, provided they have the knowledge (Savoir) and the right motivation (Fear/Vouloir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S1 (the joy of Ascension) to ~S2 (the necessity of penance/fear) as the only path to avoid S2 (future punishment).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is conditional: if the human subject performs penance (~S2), God grants S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is used as a rhetorical threat to enforce the Devoir-faire of the subject.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses the language of 'grace' and 'mercy,' it structurally functions as a merit-based system where human endurance and fear are the engines of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: God... will, when he witnesses our sincere conversion, forgive us
everything we do for God’s glory gives us ever greater title to the bliss

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the Savior opens heaven for her

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Apostles and the 'multitude of saints' are presented as models of virtue whose holiness earned them the sight of God.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The Apostles saw the Ascension not because of their holiness, but because of God's election to make them witnesses of a finished work.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Anxiety (fear of the thief in the night) or Pride (title to bliss through privation).
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is a wage for 'sincere conversion' and 'penance'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is coherent as a moral exhortation but incoherent as a Gospel proclamation because the 'Good News' of the Ascension is immediately turned into a 'Law' of preparation.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God is full of kindness' and the 'disgruntled master' image.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: those who endured the privations... are entitled to rejoice

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The hearer is expected to generate their own 'sincere conversion' to trigger God's forgiveness.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as 'failings' that can be offset by 'penance' and 'fear'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon positions the hearer as the primary Subject of the salvation drama, with Christ's Ascension serving as a historical backdrop or a reward-trigger rather than the constitutive act of grace.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'enduring', 'judging', and 'avoiding'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject of the 'opening of heaven' and the 'securing of the believer'.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'we give ourselves title to bliss,' use 'Christ’s ascension has secured for us a title we could never earn.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer with the 'feckless servant' who is saved by the Master's grace, not by their own alertness.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (The Spirit's power) and Vouloir (Grateful response to a gift).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Ascended Christ sends the Spirit to enable what we cannot do.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify the 'Opponent' as the impossibility of the human heart to reach heaven on its own.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'forgetfulness,' the solution is just 'reminding' (Moralism). If the opponent is 'Death/Sin,' the solution must be 'Christ' (Grace).

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (penance) is the condition for Soteriology (bliss).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ has ascended for us) must be the ground for Ethics (Therefore we live in hope).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a strong grasp of the historical narrative but risks turning the Gospel into a new Law by making the hearer's performance the pivot of the Ascension's benefit.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might praise the use of parallelisms in §4; Greimas reveals these parallels actually reinforce a merit-based 'resemblance' rather than grace.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the meaning of 'forty days'; Greimas shows how this detail is used to create a modal obligation (Devoir) for Lenten penance.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that 'God' is the Object of the hearer's quest, making the sermon anthropocentric despite its religious vocabulary.

appendices.notities: The sermon's structure is a classic 'if-then' contract: If man suffers/fears, then God rewards.
